tuv.seg: The President is the Head of State, although they play a mainly ceremonial role in the running of the State
Is é/í an tUachtarán Ceann an Stáit, cé gur ról deasghnách den chuid is mó atá aige/aici i dtaobh riaradh an Stáit
The current President of Ireland is Michael D
Is í Mícheál D. Ó hUiginn Uachtarán na hÉireann faoi láthair
Higgins, who commenced his first term on 11 November 2011
Chuir sé tús lena chéad téarma mar Uachtarán ar 11 Samhain 2011
The Government must approve all Presidential communications, messages or addresses, both to the Oireachtas and to the public
Ní mór don Rialtas gach cumarsáid, teachtaireacht nó aitheasc ón Uachtarán chuig dá theach an Oireachtais agus chuig an bpobal a cheadú
Many of the powers of the President can only be exercised on the advice of the Government
Is ar chomhairle an Rialtais amháin is cead don Uachtarán cuid mhaith dá c(h)umhachtaí a chomhlíonadh
This means that if the President wishes to exercise a power, they must first obtain the advice and agreement of the Government
Mar sin más mian leis an Uachtarán cumhacht a chomhlíonadh ní mór dó/di comhairle agus comhaontú an Rialtais a fháil ar dtús
The President also possesses some powers that they cannot exercise without first consulting with the Council of State
Tá cumhachtaí ag an Uachtarán nach féidir leis/léi a chomhlíonadh gan dul i gcomhairle roimh ré leis an gComhairle Stáit
